intro: Scleria tricristata, commonly known as the three-ridge sedges, is a member of the Cyperaceae family, which includes grass-like plants. It is a perennial herb characterized by its triangular stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically green or brown, and it thrives in wet or moist environments. Scleria tricristata is native to regions of Africa and is often found in marshy areas or along the edges of water bodies. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
